content:
Create a series of Apex classes that determine the content of payment requests using your own product information. In Flow Builder, create a screen flow that agents can run to send a payment messaging component to customers in messaging sessions. Add the flow to the Messaging Session page layout so agents can run it during messaging sessions. During an active messaging session, find the Flow component that's linked to the question with options and run the flow that's linked to your payment component. Insert the message and finish the flow. Click Send in the message field. The component is sent to the customer and appears in the conversation transcript.

To create this feature:

In your sandbox, go to the Apex Classes page in Setup.
Create Apex classes that determine the content of payment requests using your own product information.
In Flow Builder, create a screen flow that agents can run to send a payment messaging component to customers in messaging sessions.
Add the flow to the Messaging Session page layout so agents can run it during messaging sessions. See Add Messaging to the Service Console.
Send the component in enhanced Apple Messages for Business channels.

To use this feature:

During an active messaging session, find the Flow component that's linked to the question with options and run the flow that's linked to your payment component.
Insert the message and finish the flow.
Click Send in the message field. The component is sent to the customer and appears in the conversation transcript.

Required editions: Lightning Experience
User permissions needed:
To open, edit, or create a flow in Flow Builder: Manage Flow
To create or edit a console app: Customize Application AND View Setup and Configuration

This article applies to: Enhanced Apple Messages for Business channels.
It doesn't apply to: Messaging for In-App, Messaging for Web, Bring Your Own Channel, standard and enhanced WhatsApp, standard and enhanced Facebook Messenger, and standard and enhanced SMS channels.
title: Setting Up Payment Flows in Service Cloud Messaging
